title: ScrambledTreeBuilder
text: ScrambledTreeBuilder package outputs plots ggplot2 format need load ggplot2 package customize .
code: library(ScrambledTreeBuilder) |> suppressPackageStartupMessages() library(ggplot2)              |> suppressPackageStartupMessages()

title: ScrambledTreeBuilder
text: package utilizes example YAML files containing summary statistics halobacteria genome comparison data. regards genome scrambling, many studies showcased significant genome rearrangements halobacteria species due dozens insertion sequence families. YAML summary files produced performing vs. genome comparison six halobacteria species using nf-core pairwise genome alignment pipeline post-processing pipeline running functions GenomicBreaks package extract statistics alignment length extent genome scrambling. Examples YAML files stored extdata/yaml. file represent one pairwise alignment, file names conveys identifiers target query genomes (species names) separed three underscores (___). prepare object called ‘yamlFileData’ contains path files. Next, use formatStats() function load YAML files single dataframe line pair species column statistic metadata species comparison. data frame large number columns, providing summary statistics various aspects alignments. statistics interest, build square matrices rows columns indicate one species, cells intersection contain value pair. perform task makeMatrix() function. provide defaults missing values self-comparisons. vignette, let’s focus percent nucleotide difference scrambling index. cluster percent nucleotide difference matrix (treeMatrix) produce tree tibble format, using makeTidyTree() function.  node IDs can used manipulate tree, instance subsetting subtree() function.  Clades interest can tracked highlighted FocalClade objects. robustness changes input data clustering approach, recommented define clade recent common ancestor pair species. subTree() function can take FocalClade objects instead node IDs input. focal clade objects can added plots highlight clades selected colors.  plot data tree, add statistics tree object, scrambling index percent nucleotide difference, using makeValueTibble() function. operation reduces pairwise matrix tree, averaging pairs sharing recent common ancestor, represented internal node tree. made multiple tables show step--step process, typically one just keep last table. can done pipes.
code: yamlFileData <- system.file("extdata/yaml", package = "ScrambledTreeBuilder") |>   resultFiles() yamlFileData[1] #>                                                                              Halobacterium_litoreum___Halobacterium_noricense  #> "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/ScrambledTreeBuilder/extdata/yaml/Halobacterium_litoreum___Halobacterium_noricense.yaml.bz2" exDataFrame <- formatStats(yamlFileData) ncol(exDataFrame) #> [1] 234 colnames(exDataFrame) |> head() #> [1] "aligned_length_Min"    "aligned_length_Q1"     "aligned_length_Median" #> [4] "aligned_length_Mean"   "aligned_length_Q3"     "aligned_length_Max" colnames(exDataFrame) |> grep(pat = "_Mean", value = TRUE) |> head() #> [1] "aligned_length_Mean"      "aligned_score_Mean"       #> [3] "aligned_matches_Mean"     "aligned_mismatches_Mean"  #> [5] "aligned_gaps_target_Mean" "aligned_gaps_query_Mean" colnames(exDataFrame) |> tail() #> [1] "percent_identity_global"   "percent_difference_local"  #> [3] "percent_difference_global" "index_avg_strandDiscord"   #> [5] "percent_aligned"           "lab" # Percent nucleotide difference  We will use it to cluster a tree. treeMatrix <- 100 - makeMatrix(exDataFrame, "percent_identity_global", 100, 50) round(treeMatrix) #>                         Halobacterium_litoreum Halobacterium_noricense #> Halobacterium_litoreum                       0                      21 #> Halobacterium_noricense                     21                       0 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                     24                      25 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                      32                      34 #> Haloferax_volcanii                          30                      30 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                       27                      28 #>                         Halobacterium_salinarum Haloferax_mediterranei #> Halobacterium_litoreum                       24                     31 #> Halobacterium_noricense                      25                     32 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                       0                     33 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                       33                      0 #> Haloferax_volcanii                           32                     20 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                        28                     31 #>                         Haloferax_volcanii Salarchaeum_japonicum #> Halobacterium_litoreum                  30                    27 #> Halobacterium_noricense                 30                    28 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                 32                    28 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                  20                    32 #> Haloferax_volcanii                       0                    30 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                   30                     0 #> attr(,"builtWith") #> [1] "percent_identity_global" # Scrambling index valueMatrix <- 1 - makeMatrix(exDataFrame, "index_avg_strandRand", 1, 0.5) round(valueMatrix, 2) #>                         Halobacterium_litoreum Halobacterium_noricense #> Halobacterium_litoreum                    0.00                    0.61 #> Halobacterium_noricense                   0.61                    0.00 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                   0.47                    0.77 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                    0.92                    0.93 #> Haloferax_volcanii                        0.94                    0.95 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                     0.82                    0.87 #>                         Halobacterium_salinarum Haloferax_mediterranei #> Halobacterium_litoreum                     0.47                   0.92 #> Halobacterium_noricense                    0.77                   0.93 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                    0.00                   0.93 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                     0.93                   0.00 #> Haloferax_volcanii                         0.87                   0.68 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                      0.92                   0.89 #>                         Haloferax_volcanii Salarchaeum_japonicum #> Halobacterium_litoreum                0.94                  0.81 #> Halobacterium_noricense               0.95                  0.87 #> Halobacterium_salinarum               0.88                  0.92 #> Haloferax_mediterranei                0.68                  0.89 #> Haloferax_volcanii                    0.00                  0.99 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                 0.99                  0.00 #> attr(,"builtWith") #> [1] "index_avg_strandRand" # Let's average the target-query and query-target replicate pairs. (Tibble <- makeTidyTree((treeMatrix/2 + t(treeMatrix)/2))) #> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 11 × 6 #> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo  #> # via as.treedata or as.phylo #>    parent  node branch.length label                   isTip     y #>     <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>                   <lgl> <dbl> #>  1     11     1         10.6  Halobacterium_litoreum  TRUE   5    #>  2     11     2         10.6  Halobacterium_noricense TRUE   6    #>  3     10     3         12.3  Halobacterium_salinarum TRUE   4    #>  4      8     4          9.85 Haloferax_mediterranei  TRUE   1    #>  5      8     5          9.85 Haloferax_volcanii      TRUE   2    #>  6      9     6         13.9  Salarchaeum_japonicum   TRUE   3    #>  7      7     7         NA    NA                      FALSE  2.69 #>  8      7     8          5.79 NA                      FALSE  1.5  #>  9      7     9          1.75 NA                      FALSE  3.88 #> 10      9    10          1.57 NA                      FALSE  4.75 #> 11     10    11          1.70 NA                      FALSE  5.5 visualizeTree(Tibble) visualizeTree(Tibble |> subTree(9)) (Halobacterium <- focalClade(Tibble, "Halobacterium_noricense", "Halobacterium_salinarum", "blue", "Halobacterium genus")) #> Halobacterium genus, node ID: 10, number of genomes: 3 Halobacterium@genomeIDs #> [1] "Halobacterium_litoreum"  "Halobacterium_noricense" #> [3] "Halobacterium_salinarum" Halobacterium@nodeID #> [1] 10 subTree(Tibble, Halobacterium) #> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 5 × 6 #> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo  #> # via as.treedata or as.phylo #>   parent  node branch.length label                   group node.orig #>    <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>                   <fct>     <int> #> 1      5     1         10.6  Halobacterium_litoreum  1             1 #> 2      5     2         10.6  Halobacterium_noricense 1             2 #> 3      4     3         12.3  Halobacterium_salinarum 1             3 #> 4      4     4          3.32 NA                      1            10 #> 5      4     5          1.70 NA                      1            11 Haloferax <- focalClade(Tibble, "Haloferax_mediterranei", "Haloferax_volcanii", "green3", "Haloferax genus") (clades <- FocalCladeList(Halobacterium, Haloferax)) #> Halobacterium genus, node ID: 10, number of genomes: 3 #> Haloferax genus, node ID: 8, number of genomes: 2 visualizeTree(Tibble) + clades + ggtitle("Focal clade highlight") (tibbleWithValues <- makeValueTibble(Tibble, valueMatrix, colname = "Scrambling_index")) #> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 11 × 7 #> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo  #> # via as.treedata or as.phylo #>    parent  node branch.length label                 isTip     y Scrambling_index #>     <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>                 <lgl> <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1     11     1         10.6  Halobacterium_litore… TRUE   5              NA     #>  2     11     2         10.6  Halobacterium_norice… TRUE   6              NA     #>  3     10     3         12.3  Halobacterium_salina… TRUE   4              NA     #>  4      8     4          9.85 Haloferax_mediterran… TRUE   1              NA     #>  5      8     5          9.85 Haloferax_volcanii    TRUE   2              NA     #>  6      9     6         13.9  Salarchaeum_japonicum TRUE   3              NA     #>  7      7     7         NA    NA                    FALSE  2.69            0.926 #>  8      7     8          5.79 NA                    FALSE  1.5             0.683 #>  9      7     9          1.75 NA                    FALSE  3.88            0.869 #> 10      9    10          1.57 NA                    FALSE  4.75            0.618 #> 11     10    11          1.70 NA                    FALSE  5.5             0.605 (tibbleWithMultipleValues <- makeValueTibble(tibbleWithValues, treeMatrix, colname = "Percent_difference")) #> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 11 × 8 #> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo  #> # via as.treedata or as.phylo #>    parent  node branch.length label                 isTip     y Scrambling_index #>     <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>                 <lgl> <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1     11     1         10.6  Halobacterium_litore… TRUE   5              NA     #>  2     11     2         10.6  Halobacterium_norice… TRUE   6              NA     #>  3     10     3         12.3  Halobacterium_salina… TRUE   4              NA     #>  4      8     4          9.85 Haloferax_mediterran… TRUE   1              NA     #>  5      8     5          9.85 Haloferax_volcanii    TRUE   2              NA     #>  6      9     6         13.9  Salarchaeum_japonicum TRUE   3              NA     #>  7      7     7         NA    NA                    FALSE  2.69            0.926 #>  8      7     8          5.79 NA                    FALSE  1.5             0.683 #>  9      7     9          1.75 NA                    FALSE  3.88            0.869 #> 10      9    10          1.57 NA                    FALSE  4.75            0.618 #> 11     10    11          1.70 NA                    FALSE  5.5             0.605 #> # title: ScrambledTreeBuilder
text: Let’s use tibbleWithMultipleValues object plot trees. case, generated tree built based nucleotide percent difference values distance, computed average scrambling index nodes. can plot values labels tree.   course, spotted interesting sub-tree, can plot node IDs easily extract analysis.  subTree function can conveniently used R’s pipe operator cut sub-tree chosen node.
code: visualizeTree(tibbleWithMultipleValues, "Scrambling_index") +   ggplot2::ggtitle(paste("Tree built with Percent difference and labelled with Scrambling Index")) + clades visualizeTree(tibbleWithMultipleValues, tibbleWithMultipleValues$Scrambling_index, ynudge = 0.2) +   ggplot2::ggtitle("Tree labeled with Scrambling Index and Percent Difference") +   ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_c(name = "Scrambling index", option = "cividis") +   ggnewscale::new_scale_colour() +   ggtree::geom_label(ggtree::aes(label=round(Percent_difference), color = Percent_difference), label.size = 0.25, size = 3, na.rm = TRUE, label.padding = ggtree::unit(0.15, "lines"), nudge_y = -0.2) +   viridis::scale_color_viridis(option = "magma", name = "Percent Identity") visualizeTree(tibbleWithMultipleValues) visualizeTree(tibbleWithMultipleValues |> subTree(node = 9), "Percent_difference") subMatrix(Tibble, valueMatrix, 9, simpl=TRUE) #>             H_litoreum H_noricense H_salinarum S_japonicum #> H_litoreum   0.0000000   0.6054199   0.4662469   0.8119173 #> H_noricense  0.6073435   0.0000000   0.7667464   0.8669942 #> H_salinarum  0.4677172   0.7676303   0.0000000   0.9210253 #> S_japonicum  0.8192124   0.8669109   0.9218979   0.0000000

title: ScrambledTreeBuilder
text: can also plot leaf node values standard scatterplot.
code: plot(100 - exDataFrame$percent_identity_global, 1 - exDataFrame$index_avg_strandRand, col = 'grey', xlab = "Percent difference", ylab="Strand randomisation index", main = "Leaf values are in grey and node values in red") points(tibbleWithMultipleValues$Percent_difference, tibbleWithMultipleValues$Scrambling_index, col = 'red')  plotTwoBranches <- function(tree, node, X, Y, ...) {   children <- tidytree::child   (tree, node)   if(nrow(children) != 2) return(invisible())   parent   <- tidytree::parent(tree, children$node[1])   lines(     c(parent[, X, drop=T], children[, X, drop=T][1]),     c(parent[, Y, drop=T], children[, Y, drop=T][1]),     ...   )   lines(     c(parent[, X, drop=T], children[, X, drop=T][2]),     c(parent[, Y, drop=T], children[, Y, drop=T][2]),     ...   ) }  plotAllBranches <- function(tree, X, Y, ... ) {   unique(tree$parent) |> sort() |> sapply(\(node) {     plotTwoBranches(tree, node, X, Y, ...)   })   return(invisible()) }  plotAllBranches(tibbleWithMultipleValues, "Percent_difference", "Scrambling_index", col = "red")

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
text: Make matrix data frame containing species data.

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
code: makeMatrix(   DF,   column,   defaultDiagonal = 100,   defaultValue = NA,   impute = c("no", "average", "missForest", "missForest2"),   ... )

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
text: DF Data frame containing species information, produced formatStats() column variable data frame extract species data . defaultDiagonal Maximum possible value variable. defaultValue Minimum possible value variable. impute Method impute missing value. Defaults . ... arguments passed imputing function.

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
text: square matrix rows columns sample identifiers values statistics pairs samples.  addition attribute "builtWith" records value column.

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
text: case missing values, following options available. Leave missing (NA). default. Give fixed value defined devaultValue option. Impute replicate (target query roles exchanged) available (impute=average), else give default value. Impute replicate, random forests (impute=missForest).  Hide diagonal values (extreme) (impute=missForest2).

title: Pairwise comparison matrix — makeMatrix
text: Noa Brenner Charles Plessy Anika Mittal

what: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
text: function removes outliers (pairs high identity low total aligned genome) results dataframe based specified thresholds percent identity alignment length.

title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
code: remove_outliers(   df,   percent_identity_col,   alignment_length_col,   percent_identity_threshold = NULL,   alignment_length_threshold = NULL )

title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
text: df dataframe containing alignment results data. percent_identity_col column name percent identity values. alignment_length_col column name normalized alignment length values. percent_identity_threshold threshold percent identity (optional). alignment_length_threshold threshold alignment length (optional).

title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
text: new dataframe outliers removed.

title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
text: Anika Mittal

title: Remove outliers based on thresholds or quartiles — remove_outliers
code: remove_outliers(results, "percent_identity_local", "percent_aligned", 90, 10) #> Error: object 'results' not found

title: List YAML result files — resultFiles
text: Given directory containing YAML files output pipeline https://github.com/oist/plessy_nf_GenomicBreaks/, prepare vector listing files, possibly removing ones matching keywords give separate input file.

title: List YAML result files — resultFiles
code: resultFiles(dir, remove = "removedAssemblies.txt")

title: List YAML result files — resultFiles
text: dir Directory containing YAML files. remove File containing patterns element removal.

title: List YAML result files — resultFiles

what: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
text: Given matrix values rows column names species names labels tree, subset matrix species present subtree starting given node.

title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
code: subMatrix(tree, m, clade = NULL, simplify.names = FALSE)

title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
text: tree ConvenientTblTree object. m matrix, typically output makeMatrix(). clade FocalClade object ID number node base subtree.  default NULL case input tree already subtree (see examples). simplify.names Reduce genus name single letter.

title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
text: subset m matrix.

title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
text: Charles Plessy

title: Subset a matrix with a subtree — subMatrix
code: # Subset with a node subMatrix(Halo_Tree, Halo_PercentDiff, 9) #>                         Halobacterium_litoreum Halobacterium_noricense #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 0.00000                21.18801 #> Halobacterium_noricense               21.26064                 0.00000 #> Halobacterium_salinarum               24.15702                25.05241 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                 27.24648                27.88932 #>                         Halobacterium_salinarum Salarchaeum_japonicum #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 24.24792              27.25050 #> Halobacterium_noricense                25.05377              27.57799 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                 0.00000              28.44185 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                  28.19145               0.00000  # Subset with a focal clade subMatrix(Halo_Tree, Halo_PercentDiff, Halo_FocalClades$Halobacterium) #>                         Halobacterium_litoreum Halobacterium_noricense #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 0.00000                21.18801 #> Halobacterium_noricense               21.26064                 0.00000 #> Halobacterium_salinarum               24.15702                25.05241 #>                         Halobacterium_salinarum #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 24.24792 #> Halobacterium_noricense                25.05377 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                 0.00000  # Simplify names for more compact display subMatrix(Halo_Tree, Halo_PercentDiff, simplify.names = TRUE) #>                H_litoreum H_noricense H_salinarum H_mediterranei H_volcanii #> H_litoreum        0.00000    21.18801    24.24792       31.27923   29.83707 #> H_noricense      21.26064     0.00000    25.05377       31.54667   30.03853 #> H_salinarum      24.15702    25.05241     0.00000       32.99448   31.51122 #> H_mediterranei   31.72595    33.57159    33.02111        0.00000   19.77441 #> H_volcanii       29.88642    30.06817    31.51689       19.60559    0.00000 #> S_japonicum      27.24648    27.88932    28.19145       31.34071   30.17554 #>                S_japonicum #> H_litoreum        27.25050 #> H_noricense       27.57799 #> H_salinarum       28.44185 #> H_mediterranei    31.58067 #> H_volcanii        30.20358 #> S_japonicum        0.00000  # Pipe a subsetted tree directly to the function subTree(Halo_Tree, 9) |> subMatrix(Halo_PercentDiff) #>                         Halobacterium_litoreum Halobacterium_noricense #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 0.00000                21.18801 #> Halobacterium_noricense               21.26064                 0.00000 #> Halobacterium_salinarum               24.15702                25.05241 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                 27.24648                27.88932 #>                         Halobacterium_salinarum Salarchaeum_japonicum #> Halobacterium_litoreum                 24.24792              27.25050 #> Halobacterium_noricense                25.05377              27.57799 #> Halobacterium_salinarum                 0.00000              28.44185 #> Salarchaeum_japonicum                  28.19145               0.00000

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
text: Takes tbl_tree object representing tree, extracts subtree given node.

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
code: subTree(tree_tibble, node, ...)

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
text: tree_tibble ConvenientTblTree object. node ID number node base subtree, FocalClade object. ... arguments (currently ignored)

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
text: subtree represented tbl_tree class tidytree package.  tibble extra node.orig column providing old node IDs, node IDs object renamed extraction subtree.

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
text: Charles Plessy

title: Extract a subtree — subTree
code: (subtree <- subTree(Halo_Tree, 9)) #> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 7 × 8 #> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo  #> # via as.treedata or as.phylo #>   parent  node branch.length label     group Percent_difference Scrambling_index #>    <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>     <fct>              <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1      7     1         10.6  Halobact… 1                   NA             NA     #> 2      7     2         10.6  Halobact… 1                   NA             NA     #> 3      6     3         12.3  Halobact… 1                   NA             NA     #> 4      5     4         13.9  Salarcha… 1                   NA             NA     #> 5      5     5          1.75 NA        1                   27.8            0.869 #> 6      5     6          1.57 NA        1                   24.6            0.618 #> 7      6     7          1.70 NA        1                   21.2            0.605 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: node.orig <int> visualizeTree(subtree, subtree$node.orig)

what: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
text: Plot phylogenetic tree node data

title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
code: visualizeTree(   your_tibble,   value = "node",   valueround = 2,   outerlabelsize = 0.25,   innerlabelsize = 3,   ynudge = 0,   xnudge = 0 )

title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
text: your_tibble ConvenientTblTree object. value Tibble value label internal nodes tree, name column tree object. valueround Number integers round value. outerlabelsize Size label border. innerlabelsize Overall size label. xnudge, ynudge Adjust horizontal vertical position labels (useful plotting multiple labels).

title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
text: phylogenetic tree showcasing phylogeny species, additional node values, just node IDs.  legend show displaying node IDs.

title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
text: Noah Brenner Charles Plessy

title: Plot a phylogenetic tree and its node data — visualizeTree
code: visualizeTree(Halo_Tree)  visualizeTree(Halo_Tree, value = Halo_Tree$Scrambling_index)  visualizeTree(Halo_Tree, "Scrambling_index") # same
